abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Desert Locust
            Control Project of Algeria were to provide urgent assistance
            in support of Algeria's national locust control program
            and to support the reinforcement of comprehensive
            surveillance and warning systems to better monitor and
            predict locust activity in the country. Partly as a result
            of the successful anti-locust campaigns mounted by Algeria
            and other countries between 1987 and 1988, there was minimal
            locust activity during the project period and consequently
            little damage was inflicted to agriculture. Thus, although
            the benefits of the project cannot be quantified as had been
            done at appraisal, the project achieved its main objective
            which was to ensure that Algeria would have the
            institutional capacity and effective means at its disposal
            to (a) control any impending locust invasions and (b)
            predict locust activity and movement thereby facilitating
            planning and implementation of future control programs, both
            in situations of plague and recession.
